definition: Taroko gorge national park in Hualien County 花蓮縣|花莲县[Hua1 lian2 Xian4], Taiwan/Taroko ethnic group Taiwan
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
pavilion (usu. two-storied)/cabinet (politics)/boudoir/woman's chamber/rack/shelf
Taroko, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

sentences.english: Truku refers to a mountain plateau or a place suitable for living.
sentences.chinese: 太鲁阁，意指山腰的平台或可居住之地。

sentences.english: Visitors to Taroko Gorge always admire the beautiful scenery there.
sentences.chinese: 到太鲁阁游览的旅客总是赞赏那里优美的风景。

sentences.english: Among the popular scenic spots, Taroko gorge is the one of the best.
sentences.chinese: 在有名的景点里，太鲁阁峡谷是最棒的一个。

sentences.english: The Li family visited Taroko National Park last month.
sentences.chinese: 林家上个月去太鲁阁国家公园玩。

sentences.english: Taroko Gorge is famous for its beautiful scenery.
sentences.chinese: 太鲁阁是以它美丽的风景闻名。

sentences.english: We could stay in that five-star hotel in Taroko Gorge again.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以再去那间在太鲁阁的五星级饭店。

sentences.english: Ancestral spirit worship forms the core of the Truku spiritual beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 太鲁阁人的信仰，是以祖灵为中心的集体意识。

sentences.english: Taroko Tilting Electric Multiple Unit TEMU1000 was entering Keelung Station.
sentences.chinese: 太鲁阁号倾斜式列车正通过港西街平交道进入基隆站。

sentences.english: This is the entrance of Taroko Gorge National Park.
sentences.chinese: 太鲁阁国家公园嘅入口。

sentences.english: Yalong Bay's natural beauty attracts tourists.
sentences.chinese: 太鲁阁以自然美吸引游客。

sentences.english: Taroko Gorge attracts a lot of tourists, especially in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 太鲁阁引很多观光客，尤其在夏天的时候。

definition: Suhua Highway, coastal road in northern Taiwan, built on the side of cliffs above the Pacific Ocean
Hualien, city and county on the east coast of Taiwan
Kenting, a national park on the southern tip of Taiwan, popular as a tourist destination (abbr. for 墾丁國家公園|垦丁国家公园[Ken3 ding1 Guo2 jia1 Gong1 yuan2])
Fenchihu, town in Chiayi County, Taiwan
Jinguashi, town in Ruifang District, New Taipei City, Taiwan, noted for its historic gold and copper mines, used as a prisoner-of-war camp by the Japanese (1942-1945)
Puli, town in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
Kenting National Park on the Hengchun Peninsula 恆春半島|恒春半岛[Heng2 chun1 Ban4 dao3], Pingtung county, south Taiwan
pinyin: Ken3 ding1 Guo2 jia1 Gong1 yuan2

definition: Qijin or Chichin district of Kaohsiung city 高雄市[Gao1 xiong2 shi4], south Taiwan
Sun Moon Lake in Nantou County, Taiwan
Yilan city and county 宜蘭縣|宜兰县[Yi2 lan2 xian4], northeast Taiwan
Jiaoxi or Chiaohsi township in Yilan county 宜蘭縣|宜兰县[Yi2 lan2 xian4], Taiwan
Alishan township in Chiayi county 嘉義縣|嘉义县[Jia1 yi4 xian4], west Taiwan
Alishan, mountain range in Taiwan
Tainan (city and county in Taiwan)
Taimali township in Taitung County 臺東縣|台东县[Tai2 dong1 Xian4], southeast Taiwan
Jiufen (or Jioufen or Chiufen), mountainside town in north Taiwan, former gold mining town, used as the setting for two well-known movies
Nantou city and county in central Taiwan
